attributes.action: Allow outdoor weddings to follow the same rules as Scotland for England & Wales
attributes.additional_details:
Apparently this is already under review (since 2018) but we believe should be pushed immediately through. Considering that Covid-19 has meant many couples have had to change plans, 
relaxing the rules would give people the flexibility to get married in places they feel safe, at a lower cost considering the likelihood that only small numbers can be present. It would also provide capacity to cater for the "backlog" of weddings in 2021 by opening up more possible venues.
attributes.background: Remove the need to get married under a licensed structure, and follow Scotland & NI in allowing outdoor weddings as long as a celebrant or registrar is present.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319121
